title: What is JavaScript?
answer_1: A programming language used to create interactive effects within web browsers
answer_2: A markup language used to structure and display content on the web
answer_3: A database management system used to store and retrieve data on the web
answer_4: A server-side scripting language used to create dynamic web pages
right_answer: A programming language used to create interactive effects within web browsers

title: What is a variable in JavaScript?
answer_1: A named container used to store data values
answer_2: A function that performs a specific task
answer_3: A keyword used to declare a loop
answer_4: A data type that represents a sequence of characters
right_answer: A named container used to store data values

title: What is the difference between var, let, and const in JavaScript?
answer_1: var is function-scoped, let is block-scoped, and const is block-scoped and cannot be reassigned
answer_2: var is block-scoped, let is function-scoped, and const is block-scoped and can be reassigned
answer_3: var is block-scoped and can be reassigned, let is function-scoped and can be reassigned, and const is block-scoped and cannot be reassigned
answer_4: var is function-scoped and cannot be reassigned, let is block-scoped and can be reassigned, and const is block-scoped and can be reassigned
right_answer: var is function-scoped and can be reassigned, let is block-scoped and can be reassigned, and const is block-scoped and cannot be reassigned

title: What is a function in JavaScript?
answer_1: A named container used to store data values
answer_2: A keyword used to declare a loop
answer_3: A data type that represents a sequence of characters
answer_4: A block of code designed to perform a specific task
right_answer: A block of code designed to perform a specific task

title: What is an array in JavaScript?
answer_1: A data type that represents a sequence of characters
answer_2: A named container used to store data values
answer_3: A function that performs a specific task
answer_4: A collection of data values that can be accessed by index
right_answer: A collection of data values that can be accessed by index

title: What is a conditional statement in JavaScript?
answer_1: A block of code designed to perform a specific task
answer_2: A keyword used to declare a loop
answer_3: A statement that performs a calculation
answer_4: A statement that performs a test and executes code based on the result
right_answer: A statement that performs a test and executes code based on the result

title: What is a loop in JavaScript?
answer_1: A keyword used to declare a conditional statement
answer_2: A keyword used to declare a function
answer_3: A block of code designed to perform a specific task
answer_4: A structure used to repeat a block of code multiple times
right_answer: A structure used to repeat a block of code multiple times

title: What is a callback function in JavaScript?
answer_1: A function that is executed immediately when it is defined
answer_2: A function that is called when an event occurs
answer_3: A function that is passed as an argument to another function and executed inside that function
answer_4: A function that is used to declare a loop
right_answer: A function that is passed as an argument to another function and executed inside that function

title: What is the DOM in JavaScript?
answer_1: A programming language used to create interactive effects within web browsers
answer_2: A database management system used to store and retrieve data on the web
answer_3: A markup language used to structure and displaycontent on the web
answer_4: A programming interface for web browsers that allows JavaScript to manipulate HTML and CSS
right_answer: A programming interface for web browsers that allows JavaScript to manipulate HTML and CSS

title: What is an event listener in JavaScript?
answer_1: A function that is executed immediately when it is defined
answer_2: A function that is called when an event occurs
answer_3: A function that is used to declare a loop
answer_4: A block of code designed to perform a specific task
right_answer: A function that is called when an event occurs
